Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bottle
Description: Lovely vase with an ovoid body and a high and narrow neck with a flared rim and convex lip. The highly micaceous clay is fine, containing an organic temper, and is covered with a brick-red wash. Two concentric circles were impressed on the shoulder before firing. Three vessels of this type were placed in this 18th Dynasty child's tomb.
